_description: Animate a starting image into video
_usage: Provide a first frame image and describe the animation

subject.reference: The [SUBJECT_TYPE] shown in the input image

input_image.description: Portrait of elegant woman in evening dress, looking slightly off-camera

subject.action_description: She slowly turns her head toward camera and begins to speak

action.secondary: eyes focus on camera, lips begin to move

scene.maintain: Lighting, background, color palette, clothing, makeup
scene.evolve: Head position, eye direction, expression becomes more engaging

audio.dialogue: She says softly: "I've been waiting for you."

input_image.description: Mountain landscape at golden hour, snow peaks, valley below

subject.reference: The mountain landscape in the image
subject.action_description: Clouds move across sky, light shifts as sun sets

action.secondary: light transitions from golden to purple

scene.evolve: Sky colors, cloud positions, lighting warmth decreases

input_image.description: Coffee cup on wooden table, steam visible, morning light

subject.reference: The coffee cup from the image
subject.action_description: Steam rises continuously, subtle light flicker

action.secondary: light subtly shifts as if cloud passing

scene.maintain: Table, cup position, overall lighting mood, composition

audio.ambience: Ambience: quiet morning, birds outside, clock ticking

image_preparation: Use high-resolution source image (match output resolution)
Ensure image aspect ratio matches target video aspect ratio
Avoid images with text or logos
Check that image composition allows for intended movement
prompt_writing: Reference 'the subject in the image' rather than re-describing
Describe changes FROM the starting state
Keep movements subtle for best consistency
common_issues: Subject morphing: Add 'no morphing' to negatives
Style drift: Specify 'maintain style from image'
Background change: Add 'consistent background' to prompt
